pull_request.title: Legacy/current behavior of model level composition

pullrequest.title: Legacy/current behavior of model level composition

content.raw:
Or maybe we can say "libsdformat's DOM API does not support defining models directly inside parent models"? Yes, Gazebo supported it because it used the `Element` API. FYI, we don't plan to use the DOM API for Gazebo 11 other than to resolve frames. 

> Perhaps it can be stated that nesting really only works within worlds for now?

Hmm..., I'm not sure what "works" means in this context. The spec allows nesting and libsdformat's Element API lets you access the nested models, so in that sense, nesting still works, 
doesn't it?
content.html:
Or maybe we can say "libsdformat's DOM API does not support defining models directly inside parent models"? Yes, Gazebo supported it because it used the Element API. FYI, we don't plan to use the DOM API for Gazebo 11 other than to resolve frames.

Perhaps it can be stated that nesting really only works within worlds for now?

Hmm..., I'm not sure what "works" means in this context. The spec allows nesting and libsdformat's Element API lets you access the nested models, so in that sense, nesting still works, doesn't it?

content.raw:
Not an actionable item at present, but meep! :disappointed:

It would be great in the future to update `libsdformat` to have fewer singletons \(e.g. have a `Parser` class that stores settings\), and in that class have callbacks for URI handling, and let users opt into this rather complex setup…
content.html:
Not an actionable item at present, but meep!

It would be great in the future to update libsdformat to have fewer singletons (e.g. have a Parser class that stores settings), and in that class have callbacks for URI handling, and let users opt into this rather complex setup…

content.raw:
Can you add a warning here stating that nested models are not yet supported in `libsdformat 9.0`? \(I’d find that to be a pretty important detail\) Also, perhaps important to note that Classic Gazebo supported it because it did not use libsdformat DOM? \(And I guess it would stop supporting it once Classic Gazebo uses `libsdformat 9.0`?\)

Perhaps it can be stated that nesting really only works within worlds for now?
content.html:
Can you add a warning here stating that nested models are not yet supported in libsdformat 9.0? (I’d find that to be a pretty important detail) Also, perhaps important to note that Classic Gazebo supported it because it did not use libsdformat DOM? (And I guess it would stop supporting it once Classic Gazebo uses libsdformat 9.0?)

Perhaps it can be stated that nesting really only works within worlds for now?
